Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> 21 hours ago, Spacetraindriver said:
> 
> 
> Arent we wasting food..?
> 

No, we have the unlimited meat supply by the herd of bandersnatchi.
Meanwhile our indestructible colony is sitting here. We have plenty of space!
I summon the bots and take out you and your colony! My bot planet.
Aww it was so fun! Too bad the extremely radiated planet now has a lot of acid rain which destroys all your robots. My salvaged colony and who ever was left in it.
Too bad everyone disappeared...
But I'm here.
Here's Johnny!

I activate the God Mode cheat.

My colony.

Just one changed byte changes the colony save file.  

A bandersnatchi's colony. They will revenge.

I revert to an older save file.

my file

I hack your computer by starting from pentagon and download your file then delete it from your computer

My hacked file.
Too bad it had a copy of kerbiloids malware installed

I smash the computer with a hammer.

The malware is no more!

I banish you from your hill for destroying kerbiloids malware. Then I take your hill.

My [@Spacetraindriver](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/149403-spacetraindriver/) drivers ex hill

I delete colony.craft.

My <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr>.

I delete KSP.exe

My desktop.

I remove all your file storing methods.

my useless computer

I reformat the drive.

My useful computer.
I sell you a corrupted version of Norton Security and ruin your reformatted drive. My useless computer.

I load an old image of the drive from a physical backup.

My useful computer.

I burn your computer.

My pile of ashes.
I scatter the ashes across the seven seas. My oceans.

I bake a cookie to restore sanity to this game.

The cookie is up for stealing.

I take the cookie and put in a quantum-encrypted safe made from a depleted uranium and tungsten alloy.

And bury it 2 km underground.

And hire guards with automatic machine guns to protect it.

And guards to protect the guards. 

**Edited <time datetime="2017-02-21T17:16:06Z" title="02/21/2017 05:16  PM" data-short="7 yr">February 21, 2017</time> by Benjamin Kerman**
Undeground magma says *blurp!* , and the mineralized cookie floats to another continent where gets thrown out by a volcano.
